Introduced in Pakistan in 1979, the Alto initially gained popularity as the Suzuki FX, the market's cheapest car with three engine configurations: 539cc T5B, 543cc F5A, and 796cc F8B. The Pakistani Suzuki Alto is available in four variants: VX, VXR, VXR AGS, and VXL AGS, with the VXL AGS often commanding higher prices due to demand. Despite stiff competition, the Alto remains favored for its affordability, fuel efficiency, and readily available spare parts. Each generation of the Alto has seen upgrades in design, engine capacity, and features: 2nd Gen (1984): Enhanced transmission options, including 4/5 Speed Manual, 2 Speed Automatic, and 3 Speed Automatic. 3rd Gen (1988): Introduction of a sliding door in the 4-seater model and standardization of the 660cc engine. 4th Gen (1994): Removal of the sliding door, launch of the Alto SV model with fuel economy features and amenities like air conditioning, power steering, ABS, and an audio system. 5th Gen (1998): Increased dimensions and introduction of CVT transmission. 6th Gen (2004): Boxier design with a 660cc K6A engine, UV glass panel, rear camera, and infotainment system. 7th Gen (2009): Curvier exterior with modern features such as traction control and eco mode. 8th Gen (2014): Retro-style design with features like keyless entry, push-start, traction control, vehicle stability control, seven airbags, collision alert, and retractable side mirrors. Turbocharged variant available, boasting a fuel consumption of 37 km/l in Japan. 9th Gen (2021): Boxier design, larger dimensions, modern features, and new engine options, including a 660cc petrol engine for the base variant and a mild hybrid system for upper variants. The exterior of the Suzuki Alto 2024 is small and economical, allowing easy maneuverability in urban traffic. The rear lights are integrated into the bumper, and the headlights and turn signals are combined into one unit. The front grille is uniform across models, with colored door mirrors and handles exclusive to the VXL variant. Retractable mirrors are also a VXL-only feature. The interior of the Alto is basic but functional, featuring a combination of dark and light grey on the dashboard. The speedometer provides necessary information like fuel average, instant fuel average, distance to empty, and fuel indicator. The automatic gear shift is conveniently placed next to the steering wheel. The car includes analog climate control, two cupholders in the front and back, and a console box. The VXL variant adds practical features such as power windows, retractable mirrors, dual airbags, and electric power steering. The Alto 2024 is powered by the new R06A engine, a 3-cylinder 660cc engine producing up to 39 horsepower and 56 Nm of torque, coupled with a multipoint injection fuel system. Transmission options include a 5-speed manual or AGS (Auto Gear Shift). The Suzuki Alto 2024 offers impressive fuel efficiency, with an estimated mileage of 18 to 20 km/l, making it ideal for cost-conscious consumers. Maintenance is straightforward, thanks to the vehicle's long-standing presence in the market and the widespread availability of spare parts and knowledgeable mechanics. The Alto's ride and handling are characterized by its nimble performance, attributed to its small size and lightweight construction, allowing easy navigation through city streets and tight parking spaces. While it offers stability and minimal body roll, the compact size may compromise comfort and space for passengers and luggage. Competitors of the Suzuki Alto 2024 in Pakistan include Suzuki Mehran, Daihatsu Mira, Nissan Dayz, United Bravo, and Prince Pearl. Despite competition, the Alto maintains an edge due to Suzuki's reputation as a reliable brand and an extensive dealership network. Imported 660cc cars like Nissan Dayz, Daihatsu Move, and Mitsubishi Ek Wagon are also viable alternatives for consumers.

overview_text: The Toyota Hilux 2024 continues its legacy as a robust pickup truck known for its commercial utility and off-road prowess. Originating in 1968, each generation has evolved to meet global demands, with the latest 2024 model showcasing a bold exterior featuring a trapezoid grille, bi-beam LED halogen headlamps, and LED fog lamps. The interior varies across trims, with higher models offering smart entry into an all-black cabin equipped with air conditioning, power windows, and an infotainment system, while maintaining robustness with features like clutch start safety and anti-lock braking system. Engine options range from turbocharged petrol to diesel, with capacities from 2393 cc to 2755 cc, ensuring performance meets diverse needs. The Hilux's ride quality is praised for its off-road capabilities, supported by stiff suspension ideal for heavy loads, though it may compromise comfort on smoother surfaces. Maintenance benefits from local assembly, ensuring parts availability in Pakistan, albeit at a higher cost. Competing against models like the Isuzu D-Max, the Hilux stands out with its strong resale value and refined driveline, despite feedback on its basic interior and bouncy ride.

overview_text: The Toyota Prius 2024 continues its legacy as a pioneering hybrid vehicle, initially launched in 1997 and globally introduced in 2000 as the first mass-produced hybrid. The fourth-generation Prius showcases a sleek design with pointed LED headlamps, daytime running lights, fog lamps, and auto-retractable mirrors. Inside, it offers a spacious and comfortable interior with adjustable seats, a urethane-wrapped steering wheel with controls, and a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system supporting USB and Bluetooth connectivity. Standard features include dual-zone auto air conditioning, cruise control, power windows, and door locks, enhancing convenience. Safety features comprise front and rear seat belts with force limiters, IsoFix mounts, ABS, vehicle stability control, an immobilizer, and SRS airbags. The hybrid engine combines a 1798cc gasoline engine producing 72 kW and 142 Nm torque with an electric motor generating 53 kW and 163 Nm torque, paired with CVT transmission for efficient performance. The Prius 2024 delivers improved ride quality and handling, offering a smoother, more responsive driving experience with enhanced grip on the road. Maintenance may pose challenges due to parts availability, reflecting its limited presence. Competing in Pakistan with models like Honda Civic, Toyota Corolla, Toyota Aqua, and Honda Vezel, the Prius stands out for its hybrid technology and eco-friendly credentials amidst a competitive field.

overview_text: Hyundai is gearing up to introduce the all-new Hyundai H-100 to the Pakistani market, known as the Hyundai Porter in other regions worldwide. This move comes amid increasing interest and demand for pickup trucks in Pakistan, fueled by developments in the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC). The Hyundai H-100 has a solid reputation globally, having been awarded the best-selling truck title in South Korea back in 2016. In Pakistan, the 4th Generation Hyundai H-100 will initially be offered in a single cabin configuration, aligning with local market preferences and dynamics.Externally, the Hyundai H-100 2024 presents a distinctive design language. At the front, it features trapezium-styled headlights complemented by a trapezoidal chrome grille and a large rectangular air intake housed in the expansive front bumper, which also integrates fog lights. The rear of the vehicle showcases stacked three-piece taillights, while LED indicators on the side mirrors enhance visibility for safer driving. Overall, the Hyundai H-100 stands out among its competitors with its unique exterior styling.Under the hood, the Hyundai H-100 is powered by a 2.6-liter SOHC 16-valve engine paired with a 5-speed manual gearbox. This setup ensures a balance of power and efficiency, suitable for both commercial and personal use.In the Pakistani market, the Hyundai H-100 faces competition primarily from vehicles like the Suzuki Mega Carry, Daehan Shehzore, and FAW Carrier. The Suzuki Mega Carry is renowned for its durability, fuel efficiency, and spacious cargo bed, catering specifically to businesses requiring a reliable transport solution. The Daehan Shehzore, another strong contender, offers versatility with its cargo capacity and comfortable cabin, appealing to both commercial users and private individuals. Meanwhile, the FAW Carrier stands out for its compact size, making it ideal for navigating urban environments with ease, coupled with affordability and reliability. Each of these competitors brings its unique strengths to the table, ranging from robust cargo capabilities to efficient maneuverability in city settings. With its competitive pricing and distinctive design, the Hyundai H-100 aims to carve out its niche in Pakistan's competitive pickup truck market, offering customers a compelling option for their transportation needs.

overview_text: Regal Automobiles launched the Prince Pearl hatchback in Pakistan in 2019. This front-wheel-drive car has a 796cc, three-cylinder, water-cooled EFI engine that produces 40 hp at 5500 RPM and 60.5 Nm torque at 3500 RPM. Notable features include an LCD screen, fog lamps, power windows, power steering, power door locks, a spare tire, and an optional airbag, with a 3-year or 60,000KM warranty.The 2024 Prince Pearl sports a sleek, sporty exterior with a wide black grill, enhanced front bumper, halogen headlamps with DRLs, and 13-inch alloy rims. The car has disc brakes in the front and drum brakes in the rear, with booster brakes instead of ABS. LED turn signals are integrated into powered, retractable side mirrors, and the design features pronounced cuts and curves with substantial ground clearance. The rear resembles the Suzuki Cultus, featuring a rear brake lamp, reflectors, and an automatic boot.Inside, the Prince Pearl boasts a silver-black tone with wooden accents, power windows, central locking, a beautiful LCD, and power steering. It comfortably seats four adults. The 796cc engine delivers 40 hp and 60.5 Nm torque, making it suitable for city driving with a 4-speed manual transmission for precise gear shifting. The car offers a mileage of 20KM/L in the city and 22KM/L on highways.Known for easy handling and maneuverability, especially in tight urban spaces, the Prince Pearl's suspension absorbs shocks well, though it may wobble slightly on flat roads. Some drivers might find the seat uncomfortable and need time to adjust to the control layout. Despite minor drawbacks, it provides satisfactory performance within its price range.Maintenance is straightforward with affordable and readily available parts, though after-sales services are lacking. Competitors include the Suzuki Alto, which offers better ground clearance and fuel economy but at a higher price. The United Bravo, similar in dimensions and performance, has a larger fuel capacity and may offer more comfort features, also within a similar price range. The Prince Pearl remains a practical choice for budget-conscious buyers seeking a functional vehicle.

overview_text: The Isuzu D-Max 2024, part of the second generation launched globally in 2012, is also known as Chevrolet Colorado, GMC Canyon, and Chevrolet DMax in various markets. In Pakistan, it is available in three variants: Hi-Spark, Hi-Lander, and V-Cross, offered by Gandhara Industries, with prices ranging from PKR 69.0 lacs to 1.24 crore.The exterior of the Isuzu D-Max 2024 features a modern design with curved wheel arches and an upgraded front fascia, giving it a rugged and appealing look. overview_text: Haval, owned by Great Wall Motors, has specialized in crossovers and SUVs since its establishment as a separate brand in March 2003. The Haval Jolion, a compact crossover SUV, was introduced in 2020 and is based on the lemon platform. Locally assembled, the Jolion was launched in Pakistan on August 31, 2023, following the Haval H6 HEV.The Haval Jolion is available in the 1.5T variant, with colors including Arctic white, layers grey, black pearl, and Burgundy red. The 2024 price in Pakistan is RS 80.3 lacs, with the 1.5T variant priced at RS 8,028,490. The interior of the Jolion features luxurious leather seats, electrically adjustable driver and front passenger seats, foldable rear seats, front heated seats, a manually adjustable steering wheel, and a 12V power outlet. It also includes wireless charging, keyless entry, a push start button, and multiple driving modes (standard, eco, sports, and snow). Safety features include an anti-lock braking system and electric power steering.The exterior of the Haval Jolion includes LED headlamps, rear fog lights, split DRLs, a panoramic sunroof, foldable rearview mirrors, a tire pressure management system, chrome grilles, halogen headlamps with follow me home function, and large cargo space. Safety is enhanced by dual front, side, and curtain airbags, hill-start assist control, hill descent control, electronic stability control, and traction control.The Haval Jolion is powered by a 1500cc petrol engine with 141-150 hp, adhering to Euro 5 plus emission standards and featuring an automatic transmission. It has a front-wheel-drive system, with a mileage of 10-12 KM/L and a fuel tank capacity of 55 liters. The top speed ranges from 180-220 KM/H.Competitors include the Kia Sportage, MG HS, and Proton X70. The Kia Sportage has similar mileage, higher fuel tank capacity, and more cargo space. MG HS offers less mileage but comparable fuel capacity and more boot space. Proton X70 matches the Jolion in mileage, fuel tank capacity, and boot space, but both face challenges with spare parts availability.For maintenance, vehicle owners should conduct annual car inspections, check the battery every 3-5 years, and inspect the engine every 12,000 to 15,000 miles to ensure proper functioning and avoid potential damage.

overview_text: BAIC (Beijing Automotive Industry Holding Co., Ltd.), a Chinese state-owned company, is entering the Pakistani market through a collaboration with Sazgar Motors, introducing the BJ40 Plus, an off-road SUV tailored for rough terrains. First launched in 2013, the BJ40 initially featured a 2.4-liter four-cylinder petrol engine and came in four variants: BJ40 S, BJ40 P, BJ40 C, and BJ40 SE. In 2019, it received a facelift named BJ40 Plus, with a 2.0-liter turbo engine and updated design.The BJ40 Plus 2024 boasts a robust exterior with a high anti-roll frame and 210 mm ground clearance, resembling the Jeep Wrangler. Its front features a vertical grille with LED headlamps, daytime running lights, and fog lamps. The interior includes monochromatic and polychromatic ambient lighting. The car has bright silver plating on the exterior and is equipped with front and rear red towbars, skid pads, radar brackets, and green window glass for sun protection. Additional features include automatic wipers and a high-mounted stop lamp.Inside, the BJ40 Plus offers a clean, bold design with a leather-wrapped steering wheel, a 12.3" LCD instrument panel displaying various metrics, and an anti-glare rearview mirror. The seats are adjustable, with the driver√ïs seat offering electric lumbar adjustment. The car has a 10.25" HD central control panel for multimedia and phone connectivity, a hi-fi stereo system with six speakers, USB ports, and onboard Wi-Fi. It also features automatic air conditioning and an automotive-grade CN95 air filtration system.The BJ40 Plus is powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged petrol engine producing 218 hp and 320 Nm of torque, available with a five-speed manual or six-speed automatic transmission. It supports four driving modes: ECO, comfort, sport, and snowfield, and includes an electrical part-time 4WD. The car has a fuel consumption of 14.9 liters per 100 km in the city and 8.0 liters on highways, with an 80-liter fuel tank and a top speed of 160 km/h.Equipped for off-road adventures, the BJ40 Plus has several safety and driver-assist features. Its assembly in Pakistan by Sazgar Motors ensures easy availability of spare parts and maintenance. The BJ40 Plus competes internationally with the Jeep Wrangler and locally with vehicles like the Haval H6, Toyota Fortuner, and Toyota Hilux Revo. The Haval H6, though similar in price and fuel efficiency, is more city-oriented. The Toyota Fortuner, also an off-roader, is less powerful, while the Toyota Hilux, a strong pickup, is more suitable for off-roading but lacks the SUV features of the BJ40 Plus.

It received a facelift in 2016 and added a six-speed automatic in 2017. The second generation, launched in 2019, is built on PSA's Common Modular Platform (CMP) and offers both internal combustion and electric versions, the latter named e-2008 with a 100 kW motor and 50-kWh battery.The 2024 Peugeot 2008 features a distinctive exterior with sharp lines, 3-claw LED headlamps, LED daytime running lamps, and a bold black grille. The rear includes smart LED lights, a gloss black strip, a spoiler, and twin chrome exhausts. It also has a panoramic sunroof and 17-inch alloy wheels. Inside, the suede-like leather and soft-feel plastic create a luxurious ambiance. High-mounted seats provide excellent road visibility, and the adjustable driver√ïs seat and steering wheel enhance comfort. The digital PEUGEOT 3D i-Cockpit includes a 7" HD touchscreen, head-up instrument panel, and compact steering wheel, offering a high-tech driving experience. The car supports Apple CarPlay, Android Auto, and features four USB ports, satellite navigation, and 10 speakers.Safety and driver-assist features include cruise control, hill start assist, ABS, push start/stop, smart key, parking assist, active lane keep assistance, road sign recognition, speed limit recognition, active blind spot monitoring, and an electronic stability program. Pros of the Peugeot 2008 include its affordable 3D infotainment display and stylish design, while cons include a noisy diesel engine, limited seating capacity, and a sluggish automatic gearbox.

overview_text: The JW Forland Safari 2024, a product of a collaboration between Foton Vehicles and JW SEZ, is entering the Pakistani market with plans for future exports. It features front fog lamps, a reverse camera, sensing auto door locks, and an autonomous braking system. Inside, it has an HD touchscreen, reading lamps, power mirrors, keyless entry (Deluxe variant), and a front power outlet. The vehicle is equipped with a 175/70/R14 tire, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and an immobilizer. Available in Deluxe, Comfort, and Premium variants, the prices range from RS 38-41 lacs. The Deluxe 1.5 EFI costs RS 4,099,000, Comfort RS 3,799,000, and Premium RS 4,299,000. The exterior includes a sleek design, 14-inch alloy wheels, side view mirrors with indicators, daytime running lights, and dual-tone paint. The interior features dual AC, rear folding fabric seats, a 7-seat capacity, rear AC vents, a digital infotainment system, a tachometer, Bluetooth connectivity, and speakers (four in Deluxe 1.5, two in Comfort).Powered by a petrol engine with four cylinders and a 1480cc displacement, the Safari has automatic transmission and dimensions of 4200mm x 1680mm x 1965mm. It offers a ground clearance of 172mm (270mm for Comfort) and a mileage of 8-10 km/l with a 43L fuel tank.The Safari ensures a comfortable ride with adjustable steering, stability control, autonomous braking with ABS, dual visors, and a tire pressure monitoring system. Maintenance tips include regular engine oil changes, battery checks, and periodic inspections.Competitors include Changan Karvan, Bolan, and APV. The Safari has a higher ground clearance and horsepower (107hp) compared to the Karvan, which offers better mileage but lower top speed. overview_text: The Tesla Model Y is a mid-size crossover SUV manufactured by Tesla, Inc., introduced in 2020. This milestone underscored the growing popularity and market acceptance of electric vehicles, particularly within the crossover SUV segment where the Model Y competes.
